intro: Heywoodia lucens, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy, succulent stems and pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Heywoodia lucens thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
